broom.helpers 1.3.0.9000

Get the number of observations

Source: R/model_get_n.R
model_get_n.Rd

For binomial and multinomial logistic models, will also return the number of events.

model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for default
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for glm
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for gam
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for glmerMod
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for multinom
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for coxph
model_get_n(model)

# S3 method for survreg
model_get_n(model)

Arguments

model

a model object

Details

For Poisson models, will return the number of events and exposure time (defined with stats::offset()).

For Cox models (survival::coxph()), will return the number of events and exposure time.

See tidy_add_n() for more details.

The total number of observations (N_obs), of events (N_event) and of exposure time (Exposure) are stored as attributes of the returned tibble.

This function does not cover lavaan models (NULL is returned).

See also

Other model_helpers: model_compute_terms_contributions(), model_get_assign(), model_get_coefficients_type(), model_get_contrasts(), model_get_model_frame(), model_get_model_matrix(), model_get_model(), model_get_nlevels(), model_get_offset(), model_get_response(), model_get_terms(), model_get_weights(), model_get_xlevels(), model_identify_variables(), model_list_contrasts(), model_list_terms_levels(), model_list_variables()

Examples

lm(hp ~ mpg + factor(cyl) + disp:hp, mtcars) %>%
  model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>   term         n_obs
#>   <chr>        <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)     32
#> 2 mpg             32
#> 3 factor(cyl)6     7
#> 4 factor(cyl)8    14
#> 5 hp:disp         32
#> 6 factor(cyl)4    11

mod <- glm(
  response ~ stage * grade + trt,
  gtsummary::trial,
  family = binomial,
  contrasts = list(stage = contr.sum, grade = contr.treatment(3, 2), trt = "contr.SAS")
)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 16 x 3
#>    term          n_obs n_event
#>    <chr>         <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 (Intercept)     193      61
#>  2 stage1           52      18
#>  3 stage2           52      13
#>  4 stage3           40      15
#>  5 grade1           67      21
#>  6 grade3           63      21
#>  7 trtDrug A        95      28
#>  8 stage1:grade1    17       6
#>  9 stage2:grade1    17       4
#> 10 stage3:grade1    18       7
#> 11 stage1:grade3    13       6
#> 12 stage2:grade3    19       5
#> 13 stage3:grade3    13       4
#> 14 stage4           49      15
#> 15 grade2           63      19
#> 16 trtDrug B        98      33

mod <- glm(
  Survived ~ Class * Age + Sex, data = Titanic %>% as.data.frame(),
  weights = Freq, family = binomial
)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 12 x 3
#>    term               n_obs n_event
#>    <chr>              <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 (Intercept)         2201     711
#>  2 Class2nd             285     118
#>  3 Class3rd             706     178
#>  4 ClassCrew            885     212
#>  5 AgeAdult            2092     654
#>  6 SexFemale            470     344
#>  7 Class2nd:AgeAdult    261      94
#>  8 Class3rd:AgeAdult    627     151
#>  9 ClassCrew:AgeAdult   885     212
#> 10 Class1st             325     203
#> 11 AgeChild             109      57
#> 12 SexMale             1731     367

d <- dplyr::as_tibble(Titanic) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Class, Sex, Age) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(
    n_survived = sum(n * (Survived == "Yes")),
    n_dead = sum(n * (Survived == "No"))
  )

#> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'Class', 'Sex'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
mod <- glm(cbind(n_survived, n_dead) ~ Class * Age + Sex, data = d, family = binomial)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 12 x 3
#>    term               n_obs n_event
#>    <chr>              <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 (Intercept)         2201     711
#>  2 Class2nd             285     118
#>  3 Class3rd             706     178
#>  4 ClassCrew            885     212
#>  5 AgeChild             109      57
#>  6 SexMale             1731     367
#>  7 Class2nd:AgeChild     24      24
#>  8 Class3rd:AgeChild     79      27
#>  9 ClassCrew:AgeChild     0       0
#> 10 Class1st             325     203
#> 11 AgeAdult            2092     654
#> 12 SexFemale            470     344

mod <- glm(response ~ age + grade * trt, gtsummary::trial, family = poisson)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 9 x 4
#>   term               n_obs n_event exposure
#>   <chr>              <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)          183      58      183
#> 2 age                  183      58      183
#> 3 gradeII               58      17       58
#> 4 gradeIII              60      20       60
#> 5 trtDrug B             94      31       94
#> 6 gradeII:trtDrug B     29      10       29
#> 7 gradeIII:trtDrug B    33       8       33
#> 8 gradeI                65      21       65
#> 9 trtDrug A             89      27       89

mod <- glm(
  response ~ trt * grade + offset(ttdeath),
  gtsummary::trial,
  family = poisson
)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 8 x 4
#>   term               n_obs n_event exposure
#>   <chr>              <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)          193      61  2.48e12
#> 2 trtDrug B             98      33  1.15e12
#> 3 gradeII               63      19  8.24e11
#> 4 gradeIII              63      21  6.31e11
#> 5 trtDrug B:gradeII     33      12  3.71e11
#> 6 trtDrug B:gradeIII    33       8  2.94e11
#> 7 trtDrug A             95      28  1.33e12
#> 8 gradeI                67      21  1.03e12

df <- survival::lung %>% dplyr::mutate(sex = factor(sex))
mod <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(time, status) ~ ph.ecog + age + sex, data = df)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 5 x 4
#>   term        n_obs n_event exposure
#>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)   227     164    69522
#> 2 ph.ecog       227     164    69522
#> 3 age           227     164    69522
#> 4 sex2           90      53    30507
#> 5 sex1          137     111    39015

mod <- lme4::lmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), lme4::sleepstudy)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>   term        n_obs
#>   <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)   180
#> 2 Days          180

mod <- lme4::glmer(response ~ trt * grade + (1 | stage),
  family = binomial, data = gtsummary::trial
)

#> boundary (singular) fit: see ?isSingular
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 8 x 3
#>   term               n_obs n_event
#>   <chr>              <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)          193      61
#> 2 trtDrug B             98      33
#> 3 gradeII               63      19
#> 4 gradeIII              63      21
#> 5 trtDrug B:gradeII     33      12
#> 6 trtDrug B:gradeIII    33       8
#> 7 trtDrug A             95      28
#> 8 gradeI                67      21

mod <- lme4::glmer(cbind(incidence, size - incidence) ~ period + (1 | herd),
  family = binomial, data = lme4::cbpp
)
mod %>% model_get_n()

#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>   term        n_obs n_event
#>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)   842      99
#> 2 period2       212      17
#> 3 period3       197      14
#> 4 period4       155       7
#> 5 period1       278      61
